name: WKUserNotificationHostingController
desc: A WatchKit user notification interface controller that hosts a SwiftUI view hierarchy.

items.name: init()
items.desc: Creates a notification hosting controller object that you can use to implement your notification interfaces using SwiftUI views.

items.name: var body: Body
items.desc: The root view of the view hierarchy to display for your notification interface.

items.name: class var coalescedDescriptionFormat: String?
items.desc: The format string to display when multiple notifications of the same type arrive simultaneously. If you specify a custom string, you can use the %d variable to reflect the number of notifications. If nil format will be the system default.

items.name: class var isInteractive: Bool
items.desc: If the notification should accept user input.

items.name: class var sashColor: Color?
items.desc: Color to use within the sash of the long look interface. If nil the sash will be the default system color.

items.name: class var subtitleColor: Color?
items.desc: The color to apply to the subtitle text displayed in the short look interface. If nil the text will be the default system color.

items.name: class var titleColor: Color?
items.desc: The color to apply to the text displayed in the sash. If nil the text will be the default system color.

items.name: class var wantsSashBlur: Bool
items.desc: If the sash should include a blur over the background.
